I found this web site sometime ago and thought it was interesting and very characteristic:
 
 ~~|~~ @Com: Mormonism on Space Travel, KOLOB
 
 Please share your thoughts.
 
 I should also mention that there is a twist which I will reveal in a few days.

Ok, here is the twist I mentioned.
 
 At the link above at top of the page there are the words, Corrected Version in red.
 
 If you mouse over those words you will see that it is a link.
 
 If you click on it you are taken to a page where someone is attempting to refute the things the first page said. 
 
 When I first came to that first page I was convinced it was an anti Mormon web site, then by accident I discovered the Corrected Version link.
 
 Obviously it's a subtle manipulation designed to make you think at first that what Mormons believe incredibly weird, then on the second page you think wow maybe I was to quick to pass judgment on the poor old Mormons.

I'm "Mormon." (LDS is the preferred term.) This site had me in tears on the floor. Laughing. The "Correct Version" is indeed a fairly accurate response to this site. But the original... OH MAN! I can't wait to send a link to all my LDS friends. It's priceless. I can usually understand where they get the idea from; some piece of more complex doctrine hopelessly oversimplified, taken out of context, and/or exaggerated. But this... This is HALARIOUS! I have NO idea where he gets ANY of his info from. Maybe he read an L. Ron Hubbard book, mixed it with Star Wars, Dune, and Space Odyssey, then threw in a TON of stuff that he made up, and chucked in the name "Kolob" because he's sure that he heard that someplace. I think it would be impossible for him to be more wrong if he tried. Thanks for digging this up, and thanks for checking and adding the "Correct Version"! 
 
 I'm going to start a question/answer thread about Mormons, just in case you or anybody else wants to hear what we really believe.
